edu.rice.starvote

Class PaperSpooler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rice.starvote.PaperSpooler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISpooler

    public class PaperSpooler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISpooler

    Reference implementation of ballot box paper feeder controller. The entire ballot feeding and processing sequence is controlled by this module.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • PaperSpooler

        public PaperSpooler(IStatusUpdate statusUpdater,
                    IDiverter diverter,
                    IMotor motor,
                    GPIOListener halfwaySensor,
                    IScanner scanner,
                    IValidator validator)

        Constructor. All dependency components must be supplied.

        Parameters:
        statusUpdater - Ballot status updater module.
        diverter - Ballot accept/reject diverter module.
        motor - Printer motor controller module.
        halfwaySensor - Internal printer paper sensor (HP1010 specific): reads LOW when paper is halfway through the feed path.
        scanner - Code scanner module.
        validator - Code validator module.

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        public DeviceStatus getStatus()

        Get the status of the paper feeder. Any status other than READY indicates that the device should not be used. A status of READY is returned only when the device is able to operate immediately.

        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface ISpooler
        Returns:
        Status of paper feeder device.

      • takeIn

        public void takeIn()

        Take in, scan, and process a single page from the paper feed tray.

        Preconditions
        • All necessary hardware and GPIO pins are initialized and ready to take commands
        • A validator object has been initialized
        • A ballot status receiver has been initialized
        • The device status is READY
        Effects
        • If no page is in tray, returns immediately without attempting to scan a code
        • One page is accepted or ejected from the machine, if one was present
        • The ballot status is updated and sent to the status updater as appropriate
        • The scanned code is sent to the validator
        • The device status is set to BUSY during operation
        Postconditions
        • Device status is READY, or ERROR if error occurred
        • The last ballot status sent is WAITING, or OFFLINE if error occurred

        Specified by:
        takeIn in interface ISpooler
        Throws:
        java.io.UncheckedIOException - If an I/O error occurs communicating with motor or scanner drivers.

      • eject

        public void eject()

        Not yet implemented.

        Eject the first page from the paper tray through the rejection pathway without scanning it.

        Specified by:
        eject in interface ISpooler
